result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles Atlsas Copeland Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

INCLUDES 20CM1659 & 22CM846.

Defendant appears in person and with Atty Adam Fontana in person;
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. State moves to:
22CM846:
Ct. 1 (BJ-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 2 (BJ-Repeater)>>DRI.

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
20CM1659:
Ct. 1 (Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)-Repeater)>> NO CONTEST.

22CM846:
Ct. 3 (Criminal Damage to Property-Repeater)>> NO CONTEST.
Ct. 4 (Disorderly Conduct-Repeater)>> NO CONTEST.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding. Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
20CM1659:
Ct. 1 (Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)-Repeater)>> $100 Fine plus Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Defendant has 30 Days to pay amounts in full and if unable to do so, Defendant to set up a Payment Plan with the Clerk of Court's Office.

22CM846:
Ct. 3 (Criminal Damage to Property-Repeater)>> $100 Fine plus Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Defendant has 30 Days to pay amounts in full and if unable to do so, Defendant to set up a Payment Plan with the Clerk of Court's Office.

Ct. 4 (Disorderly Conduct-Repeater)>> $100 Fine plus Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Defendant has 30 Days to pay amounts in full and if unable to do so, Defendant to set up a Payment Plan with the Clerk of Court's Office.

Adjourned: 11:05 am
